intro: Spermacoce luteovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure at the base. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth, kidney-shaped seeds.
